title: London/Westminster
name: Wellington Arch
address: Apsley Way, Hyde Park Corner, W1J 7JZ
directions: tube: Hyde Park Corner; in the centre of the Hyde Park Corner roundabout
hours: Interior access daily: Apr–Sep 10:00–18:00; Oct 10:00–17:00; Nov–Mar 10:00–16:00
content: The Arch was designed in the 1820s by Decimus Burton as a Roman-style triumphal arch to commemorate victory in the Napoleonic Wars; although money ran out before it was completed.  Adrian Jones' chariot statue on the top, "Peace descending on the Quadriga of War", was added in 1912.  The original equestrian statue, added in 1846, was widely disliked and now stands in [[Aldershot]].  The arch is now owned by English Heritage and is open to the public: it contains exhibits about the arch and English history, while the view from the top is quite impressive.  | image=Wellington-Arch.JPG
